alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:57PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Surf, High Winds, And Heavy Rain Early This Week... A strong low pressure system is expected to bring elevated surf to south and west facing shores from the Yukon Delta to Point Hope Monday and Tuesday. At this time, the highest water levels look to be Monday night and Tuesday for areas south of Nome. Areas north of Nome can expect the highest water on Tuesday and Tuesday night. Residents are encouraged to move boats and other valuables to higher ground. The system will also bring 1 to 2 inches of rain to the West Coast Sunday night through Monday evening, and southwest winds gusting to 30-45 mph Monday and Monday night in the Yukon Delta, and Monday night and Tuesday along the coast of Norton Sound.
